paper_abstract: The eccentricity of a vertex is the maximum distance from it to another vertex and the average eccentricity ecc(G) of a graph G is the mean value of eccentricities of all vertices of G. In this paper we resolve five conjectures, obtained by the system AutoGraphiX, about the average eccentricity and other graph parameters (independence number, chromatic number and the Randic index), and refute two AutoGraphiX conjectures about the average eccentricity and the spectral radius.
paper_title: On AGX Conjectures Regarding Average Eccentricity
